ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I got a little better at French, though it was not worth all the busy work and countless hours of sleep that I missed to get up at 9am 5 days a week

Reading simple French books, learnt a bit about French culture through movies, a lot of interesting/random vocabulary, memorized some nice, simple French poems, a bit of French politics and the presidential elections
Greatly improves reading and listening skills through repetition and increasing expectations throughout the course.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The audio clips and worksheet exercises in the course packet were very helpful

Often the audio programs did not line up with what was given in the course packet. Additionally, they took I think too much time. The books that we read were very interesting and reasonable portions were assigned each night.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: No I would certainly not recommend this course to anyone who does not absolutely have to take it to fulfill the language requirement or otherwise. It is plainly a bad course. The syllabus has been the same for many years and needs a revamp. 5 days a week at 9am along with at least an hour of work a night is counterproductive to the learning process. Plainly, I would strongly suggest not to take it; and if you do end up doing it (for one reason or another), don't burden yourself with the earliest section (unless you are one those morning people).
I liked the class and think the French program at Yale is pretty intense, but is really good. I'd recommend to someone who likes French and is placed into the class.
